alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Gila Bend; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 1:27PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa County through 215 PM MST... At 127 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Wickenburg to 10 miles northwest of Tonopah to 10 miles west of Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station to near Sundad. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, Wickenburg, Tonopah, Wittmann, Circle City, Sun City West, Palo Verde, Perryville, White Tank Mountain Park, Beardsley, Painted Rock Dam, Morristown, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Sundad, Wintersburg, Hassayampa and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 79 and 121. US Highway 60 between mile markers 99 and 139. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Gila Bend; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
